page.title: 15THE GOLDTHORPE TARTANEERS
page.content: The Goldthorpe Tartaneers are {majorettes}with a difference because we are majorettes and cheerleaders combined to make one group. Beryl Sanderson started the Tartaneers in Dearneside Comprehensive School in {1980.} Now a committee is chosed by popular vote. The Tartaneers train at Goldthorpe Youth Club on Mondays and Wednesdays, we used to train at Goldthorpe Junior School. Our ages are between{4 and 16 years.}At first there were nearly 200 in the group, now there are about{28 children.}Most of our uniform is red and white tartan. We name the displays is order, pick-up, square, star and spirals. Pom-poms, glockenspeils, drums and maces are used in displays at Garden Parties, Carnivals, Processions and Finningly Air display in Dearne area and sometimes Doncaster or Barnsley.
